decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted ((S )02 Rev A, (SK)56 Rev A, (SK)53 Rev D, (SK)60 Rev A, (SK)59 Rev A, 3767/03/D14-2758 v2, P4856-14(S) Rev A, Transport Assessment, planning statement, Energy Statement, Drop off/Pick up Survey, Statement of Community Involvement, Phase 1 Contamination Assessment Report, Phase 2 Geo-environmental Assessment Report, Sustainability checklist, School Travel Plan, Construction and Logistics Plan, Ecology Report, Noise Survey, BREEAM report, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Flood Risk Assessment and Design and Access Statement received on 16/04/2015, (S )01 Rev B received 23/04/2015, (SK)54 Rev D received 18/05/2015 and (SK)58 Rev D, (SK)51 Rev F, (SK)52 Rev E, (SK)55 Rev D, delivery and servicing plan technical note and figure 6.3 received on 23/06/2015) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the buildings are occupied.

Condition : 3 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted building have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 4 - Prior to first occupation of the school building, full details of both hard and soft landscape works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and 
these works shall be carried out as approved. These details shall include (proposed finished levels or contours; means of enclosure; car parking layouts; other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; hard surfacing material; minor artefacts and structures (eg. furniture, play equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting etc); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (eg drainage power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports etc); retained historic landscape features and proposals for restoration, where relevant). Soft landscape works shall include (planting plans; written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme) The landscaping shall be implemented in accordance with the approved plans prior to first occupation of the building and shall be maintained thereafter.

Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until a Construction Management Plan (CMP) covering the construction stages has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local 
Planning Authority. The CMP shall cover: 
i. a site plan 
ii. a pre-start record of site conditions on the adjoining public highway will be undertaken and agreed with the council 
iii. provision for the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors 
iv. provisions for loading and unloading of plant and materials within the site 
v. provision for the storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development 
vi. the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate 
vii. wheel washing facilities at the site exit 
viii. measures to control the emission of dust and dirt during construction 
ix. a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works 
x. appropriate vehicle routes to and from the site 
xi. measures to ensure the safety of all user of the public highway especially in the vicinity of the site 
All construction works shall be managed in accordance with the approved CMP.

Condition : 6 - Prior to first occupation of the building, details of any lighting to the proposed school building and lighting to the surrounding site shall be submitted to and approved in writing 
by the local planning authority. The lighting shall be installed in accordance with the approved plans and shall be maintained thereafter

Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the school, details of the proposed cycle parking for 42 cycles, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. All cycle parking shall be safe, covered and secure and easily accessible. The cycle parking shall be laid out in accordance with the approved plans prior to the first occupation of the 
building and shall be maintained thereafter.

Condition : 8 - Car parking to be installed prior to occupation including electric vehicle charging points and disabled parking bays The proposed car parking spaces, including electric vehicle charging points and disabled parking bays, shall be laid out and installed in accordance with the approved plans prior to the first occupation of the building.

Condition : 9 - The proposed building shall not be occupied until a delivery and servicing plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Plan shall 
provide details to how deliveries and servicing will be undertaken within the site, the measures proposed to ensure student safety on site and on the access road and the 
measures proposed to restrict loading and unloading on the public highway. All deliveries and servicing of the site shall thereafter be managed in compliance with the approved 
Delivery & Servicing Plan.

Condition : 10 - The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and shall not commence above ground until full Design Stage calculations under the National Calculation Method have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local planning Authority to show that the development will be constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions. Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and as-built certificates under the National Calculation Method should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 11 - ): No development shall take place until a BREEAM pre-assessment estimator (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority demonstrating how a 'Very Good' (minimum score 58.9%) rating will be achieved. Within three months of work starting on site a BREEAM Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that a 'Very Good' (minimum score 58.9%) rating will be achieved. Prior to first occupation of the building(s) a BREEAM Post Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that a 'Very Good' (minimum score 58.9%) rating has been achieved.

Condition : 12 - The first floor windows formed in the north west and south west elevations (facing onto the rear gardens of residential properties on Letchworth Avenue and Bedfont Lane) shall be obscure glazed and sealed shut (except for a small high level glazed section, hinged to open inwards as set out in the approved plans) and shall not be repaired or replaced 
otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 13 - No external alarm system attached to the building shall be used to indicate the start or end of lessons or the start or end of break times and any external alarm system shall only be used in the case of an emergency.
Condition : 14 - No further fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 15 - The turning circle to the front of the school building shall not be obstructed at any time

Condition : 16 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am to 6:00pm Mondays to Friday, 8:00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays, with no work to 
take place on Sundays and Bank Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority

Condition : 17 - The surface water drainage shall in installed in accordance with the approved Flood Risk Assessment as amended by subsequent emails (dated 08/06/2015 and 14/07/2015). A detailed drainage design and associated evidence should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation of the building to show that the surface water drainage methods previously approved has been built in alignment with the London Plan and associated guidance and the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems to reduce the risk of surface water flooding. The drainage system once installed should be managed for the lifetime of the development and information should be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation of the building to demonstrate how the drainage system would be managed.

Condition : 18 - No development shall take place until details have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority of a scheme providing for the insulation of the proposed  school's teaching and learning spaces against the transmission of externally generated road and rail noise (and vibration), taking account of any ventilation or plant requirements necessary, in order to ensure that the maximum noise levels permitted within the classroom do not exceed those that are specified in Table 1 of Building bulletin 93 - Acoustics Design of Schools: performance standards

Condition : 19 - Information (including Test reports) shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to first use of the building to demonstrate that the proposed noise insulation scheme is compliant with the approved standard. This shall be done by carrying out post completion noise tests inside teaching and learning spaces carried out by accredited/approved organisations. Noise tests shall be carried out taking account of worst case environmental conditions, such as easterly operations at Heathrow, peak time traffic flows wind speed, direction and presence of temperature inversion. Continuous and full logged data shall be submitted, together with parameters measuring LAeq, 30mins dB, as the upper limit for the indoor ambient noise level, both for new build and refurbishment.
description: Erection of a new two storey school building together with external works on rooftop plant and photovoltaic panels, the provision of cycle shelters, hardstanding, car parking and erection of boundary fencing
